title: Judgment on Babylon
shortSummary: Isaiah 47 pronounces a vivid prophecy against Babylon, depicted as a proud and self-reliant woman who will be humiliated and brought low. The chapter highlights God's sovereignty and justice as He declares the downfall of Babylon due to her arrogance, sorcery, and oppression of God's people.
timeline: c. 700 BC - Isaiah's prophetic ministry during the Assyrian and early Babylonian ascendancy

keyCharacters.name: Virgin Daughter of Babylon
keyCharacters.description: A symbolic representation of Babylon portrayed as a proud and self-indulgent woman who will face humiliation and judgment.

keyCharacters.name: Daughter of the Chaldeans
keyCharacters.description: Another title for Babylon emphasizing its identity as the center of the Chaldean empire, known for its power and sorcery.

keyCharacters.name: LORD of hosts
keyCharacters.description: God identified as the Redeemer and Holy One of Israel, who enacts judgment and delivers His people.

definitions.definition: Heavy stones used for grinding grain into meal, symbolizing labor and humiliation in this context.
Practices involving magic or witchcraft, condemned in Scripture and associated here with Babylon's downfall.
An ancient people who ruled Babylon and were known for astrology and occult practices.
A metaphor for loss and desolation, indicating Babylon’s coming disgrace and abandonment.

outline.heading: The Fall and Humiliation of Babylon
outline.description: Babylon is called to descend and sit in the dust, losing her throne and former glory, symbolizing her complete downfall and loss of power.

outline.heading: God’s Judgment Explained
outline.description: God reveals His anger against His people for allowing Babylon to oppress them, and pronounces the sudden destruction that will come upon Babylon for her arrogance and sorcery.

outline.heading: Babylon’s False Confidence and Futile Magic
outline.description: Babylon’s trust in her wickedness and occult practices is condemned; her wise men and astrologers will be powerless to save her from the coming desolation.

application: Trust in God’s sovereignty rather than in human wisdom or occult practices, recognizing that only the LORD can deliver and protect.
Avoid pride and self-reliance; remember that God humbles the proud and exalts the humble.
Recognize the danger of sin and rebellion against God, which leads to sudden and certain judgment.
Seek God’s mercy and redemption, as He is the Holy One and Redeemer of His people.

keyVerses.text: As for our redeemer, the LORD of hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God's identity as Redeemer and His holy authority, contrasting Babylon’s false security.

keyVerses.text: But these two things shall come to thee in a moment in one day, the loss of children, and widowhood: they shall come upon thee in their perfection for the multitude of thy sorceries, and for the great abundance of thine enchantments.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the sudden and complete nature of Babylon’s judgment due to her reliance on sorcery and pride.

keyVerses.text: Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels. Let now the astrologers, the stargazers, the monthly prognosticators, stand up, and save thee from these things that shall come upon thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse exposes the futility of trusting in occult wisdom and false prophets instead of God.
